Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam with frail parents”
Reviews.Author: Christopher T Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Really impressed with this hotel - rooms clean and good sized; quiet- asked for good view of canal at booking and was arranged. Breakfast excellent choice and service generally great. Snacks available at bar but need to eat out but many resturaunts within 5 minute slow walk. Museums lent us wheelchairs and prebooking on line meant no queues.

Reviews.Title: “50th birthday treat.”
Reviews.Author: bwm34 Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very enjoyed. The staff were very polite and alway happy to help. The between our group we had three rooms, all of them clean and comfortable complete with a canal view. I would be very happy to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: ete3
Reviews.Content: Spacious room, ones to the front of the hotel have open views over canal. Clean and functional with everything you would need. No mini bar, in fact only empty plastic cups in fridge. Toiletries pretty basic. Location quiet, within easy walking distance of concert hall area, plenty restaurants and shops, fairly upmarket.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped into something good”
Reviews.Author: gonzfamilyexplorers
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked two months in advance at the NH City Centre and after planning our trip based on restaurants and sites near the city, we were rudely bumped into the Museum Quarter for free breakfast, taxi fare and a not so bad view of the canal. The Museum hotel itself was nice and clean and the staff overall had been very good to us. We were in Amsterdam very early and our room was ready as soon as we got there. We fell asleep on our second day and dined late at the restaurant but they accommodated us and the food was very good and reasonable. The breakfast was fantastic as well. They kept our luggage until we were ready to leave for a late bus and they offered us two umbrellas which we were grateful for because it started pouring outside. While I am still sore for being bumped, our good experiences with this hotel made it a lot bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Better off going elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Martin S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although the location is good for museums and restaurants, it is expensive for what you get. The mini bar was empty, no pay movies and the public areas were in need of a revamp. The main bar closed at 11 p.m. so it was impossible to get a beer without going across the road. Service was good and the staff were helpful. All in all would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicole G
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel over a long weekend and really enjoyed our time there. The rooms are tidy and clean and the rollaway bed was suprisingly very comfortable. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the center of town, but is very close to the museums. We liked staying a little outside of the center of town because driving in the city center is quite stressful. The large amount of bikers in Amsterdam will make any driver nervous. Take note that if you park a car, the car is not actually parked at the hotel during your stay. A car service comes and drives your car to a parking lot outside of town. When you are ready to depart, you must give them 2 hours advance notice so your car will be returned in time. I was a little disappointed that wi-fi was not available for free in the rooms. The free wi-fi is only available in the lobby and is VERY slow.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Bury St Edmunds, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben L
Reviews.Content: NH Museum Quarter is a very nice hotel located near the museums and far enough away from the bar districts to provide a good nights sleep. The hotel is a short walk from multiple tram and bus stops, as well as the Van Gogh museum. WiFi is free in the lobby, but costs 10 Euro per 24hrs in the rooms. We didn't eat at the hotel, as there is plenty of great food within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay there”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: bad internet connection. you ll end up paying... Staff who dont really want to help you... Some are even rude. extremly expensive breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location for museum quarter”
Reviews.Author: BU88LE
Reviews.Content: Bedroom and bathroom both very spacious. In fact, there is so much empty space in the bedroom, it looked like it's missing a sofa or something, but anyway, it is comfortable. Overall clean, probably could do with a new shower curtain though. Friendly staff members. Close to the museumplein and concertgebouw.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting museums and the Concertgebouw”
Reviews.Author: YorkJean
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased with the level of comfort and cleanliness at the hotel.Staff on reception,in the bar and at breakfast were professional and pleasant.It is possible to get to hotel from the station on the 16 tram,but a taxi would be more comfortable. The hotel is situated close to the trendy De Pijp area, where there is an excellent choice of restaurants.The hotel is used by airline crews .Many rooms back on to a courtyard-others overlook a canal or side street. Breakfast was typically Dutch with yoghurt ,fruit cheese,ham and salamis.Omelettes were made to order at the breakfast bar. Free wi-fi for 15 mins in reception area. Not much cupboard space.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Al G Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Free Wi-fi only in the lobby. Staff were extremely helpful and efficient. The included breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Velina
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel NH Museum quarter during my birthday trip to Amsterdam earlier this year. We booked our stay through an online travel-booking site and picked a â€œsecret hotelâ€� deal at a very reduced price; the offer basically consists in knowing the location, number of stars, the facilities and the Tripadvisor rating of the hotel but not its name; not until you pay for it, that is. It worked really well as the hotel was just what we expected and the price was a really good deal. The hotel is a bit far from the train station for a walk, though we did it in about 40 min on the way there, as we love to walk around and didnâ€™t travel with heavy cases. There is a tram that takes you to the station directly and stops next to the hotel, so transport is not an issue. We chose the location for the museums but found that it was perfect for pretty much anything you might want to do in Amsterdam (although it is technically far from the city centre and the red light district). The Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum are 5 min walk away and Vondelpark is only short walk away. The Pijp district is on the other side of the canal and there are plenty of international restaurants, small cafÃ©s and nice bars. We walked to the Flour Market without a problem but took the tram when visiting the Botanical Gardens and the Hermitage Amsterdam museum. We didnâ€™t have breakfast included in our stay but were lucky enough to find the fantastic Bagels & Beans cafÃ© (Ambachtsweg 40 â€“ 42, only 7 min walk away) as soon as we arrived and we ate our breakfast there every day; I cannot recommend it enough! Restaurant wise, do try the superb Ethiopian restaurant Walia Ibex (1e Jacob van Campenstraat, 41-HS; again only 10 min walk from the hotel on the other side of the canal). We had a standard room as far as I can tell and it was a good size, with big and comfortable bed, large bathroom and lovely view of the canal below. We found service to be efficient and reception staff was always happy to help. There is a very cosy sitting area and a bar on the ground floor, level with the reception area, and we enjoyed having few glasses of wine there while using the complimentary wi-fi connection (please note that each login works for 30 min only but you can get as many free login codes as you want from reception). I would definitely stay at NH Museum Quarter again in my next visit to Amsterdam, hopefully for the unveiling of the new Rijksmuseum.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: PaulHRosmalen
Reviews.Content: Staff of this hotel is not competent. At arrival I requested some information on parking my car. The answer of the receptionist: on the other side of the road, so I asked for the price (4 euro per hour) she did not know. After that I asked for the price of using a taxi to travel to the conference centre RAI. I got a price of 75 uptill 80 euro's which is way too high for a one mile drive to a restaurant. Later I asked a taxi driver myself and got a price of 7,50 euro. After that we went into our room. First room 314, later 614. In both superior rooms the matrasses of the beds are horroble. My wife and I woke up with bag pains. I complained already at arrival and the receptionist told me that she visited a week ago a couple of rooms to find a proper bed with another guest (and she could not find a proper firm matrass). Last but not least the breakfast which is not value for money, 20 eur/person. Last year we visited this hotel as well and we were pleased in those days to stay overthere. Dear managers of NH: do something, improve quality or accept you loose customers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, quiet, friendly”
Reviews.Author: StephenSurrey
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the hotel. The staff were courteous and helpful, the location was good, not far from 197 bus stop (airport service 4E), and in walking distance to many interesting locations, very near museums (Van Gogh etc). Hotel room spacious, TV with some UK TV, kettle, fridge. Very clean. Some rooms look onto canal. Some free internet in foyer, but slow. Breakfast expensive, so can go out. Breakfast in Hannibal about 8E, lots of places to eat locally. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good htl in museum area”
Reviews.Author: FrancoGallarate
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with nice and helpfull personnel. Very well positioned for main museums and Leidseplein at a walkable distance (15min)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ScaryspiceKt
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend staying at this Hotel. The location was perfect. It was within easy walking distance of very nice local bars and shops. We particularly liked cafe binnen just over the canal. It was reasonably priced, great quality and very friendly. The market at Albert Cuypstraat is nice too. The hotel was 5 minutes walk in the other direction from the museums and all the action of leidesplein. We flew into schiphol airport, and took a train to Amsterdam zuid railway station. We then. Took tram 5 to museumstraat and it was 5 mins walk to the hotel from there. Other reviews have commented on unfriendly staff at this hotel but that was definitely NOT our experience...everyone was nice. The room size was great and all really clean. We didn't have breakfast....we were quoted 20 euros ppn ... There are lovely patisseries just a short walk away ..over the canal..and a mcdonalds if that is your thing!! We would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way hotel in the Museum Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MarkOlsen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NH Museum Quarter hotel at the beginning of 2012. I arrived on a Thalys train at the Centraal Station and simply took the tram (numbers 16 or 24, pay the driver 2.70 Euros - they accept bills and make change!) and went past the Rembrandtplein and Heineken Experience and got off just after going over a canal and then walked a block to the hotel. I departed on the Schiphol Sternet bus #197 to the airport for only 4 Euros. The bus only took 15 minutes and departed in front of the Rijksmuseum every 10 minutes from about 6 am to midnight. The room I had (6th floor, facing the canal) was very quiet and large by European standards but had older, worn furniture, a small closet and a small CRT television with, in English; CNN, the Discovery Channel, Comedy Channel, MTV, National Geographic, BBC and Eurosports. The room had a desk with an Ethernet port, shower with tub, some toiletries (shampoo, shower gel, etc.) central heating and air conditioning, safe, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, mini-ref and blackout curtains that really worked. The bed, in my opinion, was hard with mushy pillows. There was a self-service laundry, fitness center, breakfast (not included with my room so I can't comment on the quality), bar on the ground floor and Internet PC in the lobby available for 15 minutes at a time to check e-mails and print out boarding passes. There was also a luggage storage room for early arrivals or late departures. The hotel is located in the Oud Zuid or Old South section of Amsterdam. This area has the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum as well as the Heineken Experience and the US consulate just around the corner. I found the area to be safe, even late at night and never felt uncomfortable walking back to the hotel at any hour. Amsterdam is a small city so it only takes about 20-30 minutes to walk to the Centraal Station and Dam Square. I've stayed in other hotels in Amsterdam that were more conveniently located but with much smaller and older rooms. I enjoyed my stay at the NH Museum Quarter hotel (there are several NH hotels in Amsterdam) and would return and have recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to many museums/art galleries.”
Reviews.Author: Enigma30Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel as it was near to the family. we stayed 8 nights and found it a very pleasing experience. The staff couldn't have been more helpful! Everyone was friendly and seem to go the 'extra mile' to help us. The room on the canal side was lovely and light and larger than average. The noise of traffic did disturb us on the first night but after that we didn't really notice it! The general cleanliness was excellent. It is a long time since we have been to such a clean hotel. The only thing that was lacking was the lack of hanging space for our clothes. However we were told on our last day that we could have had a mobile wardrobe taken up to our room. Perhaps this could be mentioned in the Hotel Details found in the room? We didn't sample the breakfast as we thought it was pricey at 19 euros. There are plenty of cafes nearby that do a full English breakfast for 8.50 euros! Summing up we would not hesitate to stay here again and congratulate everyone for making our stay a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: CitySlicker420
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in August 2011. The room itself was quite large and clean. Breakfast buffee was nice and had a nice selection. The location is nice, close to the museums and the Albert Cuyp market, there's a tram stop just half a block away. All in all not a bad hotel, but the staff is just horrid. Starting from the front desk staff and all the way to the breakfast room attendants the staff was very unfriendly and just downright rude I've stayed in other NH hotels and have never encoutered such bad service.. And that is probably the only reason I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good. Close to trams stops, quiet and safe area in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Cristina V
Reviews.Content: The first time I have been in Amsterdam, and I am so looking forward to go back. In general the experience was great. On my opinion the hotel is very well located, and if I go back, I'll book this one again. It is away from the rush and busy town center, but is very close to many tram stops... I have to say that we just took the tram once to go to the Central Train Station... and we walked the way back.. is not far at all.. It is also very close to the poshest shopping street.. "Pieter Cornelisz Hooftstraat".. there is also a beautiful bakery at the "Van Baerlestraat" .. you might also want to check the "Pijp" street market, and if you are interested in Heineken.. the Heineken Experience is just around the corner.. In general the hotel service was good.. the receptionists were very helpful.. The only thing I would point out is that the breakfast, if not included, costs 16 euros each... parking is ridiculous.. we were lucky that on the day we arrived, the ticket machines were already closed for New Years eve.. so we got it for free... Another detail.. the wardrobes could be a little bit bigger.. =)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Personnel and Service Problems”
Reviews.Author: esmirnabsoluta
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms at NH Museum Quarter from their own website at a very fair rate compared to other Amsterdam Hotels. (around 86â‚¬/night) The hotel is in a good, safe and clean location, we were offered a room on third floor with canal views, our room was spacious and clean, in general our lodging experience was well above average. As other reviewers have commented, the extra services are priced very high, we didn't pay for breakfast it is not worth paying 12â‚¬ for, the internet was really expensive and although we paid for it, the connection and speed was horrible from our room. TV was really old, pay tv and other interactive options didn't work, not so many channels. The minibar was empty, but we stored some food in it which solved our breakfast issue. Some of the front office personnel was really rude as other reviewers mentioned. We had language barriers with one, who got really mad at us, then started laughing in our face which was really weird. Overall, for a clean, reasonably priced alternative in Amsterdam, definitely consider this hotel! But don't expect too much other than that. We are giving four stars for location, rooms and price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly average”
Reviews.Author: EnergizeMe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at an excellent location near the museums and main attractions in Amsterdam. Unfortunately, this is the only positive thing that I could think about after my stay there. I had expected much more for a 164 euros/night room! First of all, internet was awfully slow in my room. For a charge of almost 10 euros per 24 hours, I had expected a more reliable connection. Instead of this, it took minutes to open any web page, and it was impossible to send any business email with even a small attachment. The room looked also quite "oldish" with its past century's voluminous bulky television (and tiny screen). Again, for such prices, I expect a flat screen in the room! My mattress was extremely soft, which made it hard to sleep, and wake up with back ache. The ventilation blew only cold air, even when set at the maximum temperature. Breakfast was just ok, but the staff there was unbearable, running after each other, shouting from one side of the breakfast room to the other, not the kind of things you expect to quietly start your day. Besides, there as well, despite the 3Â°C outside temperature, ventilation was blowing cold air! I will not go again to this hotel unless with a much better deal on the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family.”
Reviews.Author: bezfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at NH MUseum Quarter for 3 nights in November. It was an easy and affordable spot to reach from the airport (take the 197 bus to and from the airport for 4 euros each way per person and it is a beautiful 5 minute walk from the hotel). It is also only 5 minutes from the VanGogh museum and the Rijk. And right past there is the Leidsplein. Back to the hotel...the staff was WONDEFUL. They were helpful with all our needs and abundance of questions without ever looking annoyed. Knowledgeable about the city and if they were stumped they looked into it and got back to us. Our room was basic but large, especially for Europe when it is hard to find family rooms. It was room 110, which got bad reviews for noise, however we had the windows closed because it was Winter and didn't hear a thing from outside. The beds were so so but the pillows were great. We were so tired from walking and exploring that we didn't mind the tube tv either. If we return to AMsterdam, which I'd love too, we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: mytravelthoughts
Reviews.Content: Good location, very close to art museums. Also easy to get to on tram from central station. Nice quiet canalside location. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious too. relatively quiet but easy to get to the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and view, but awful staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsHW
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms with a nice view of the canal, one block away from all museums. It's also very close to a bus stop, which is great for getting around town. The rooms could use a remodel, but they're not bad at all for the price we paid. It was a great experience up until the last day, when the front desk personnel threatened to call the police to make us leave. We were late for checkout for 30min and were willing to pay extra for another day if it was the case, but the staff did not allow us to. They were rude, unpolite and called every 3min, which made it harder for us to pack our stuff and finally go. This is definintely not how a quiet couple should be treated. If we were in a group of 10 loud and messy teens we would understand this treatment, but not for a couple. And definitely not for a 30min delay. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: xkahlo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on first trip to Amsterdam, great value, room was spacious and location was great for museum district. Will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: PerthAngie
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not in the heart of the tourist district, the tram is easy to catch and will have you in the city centre in 15 mins. The hotel is within walking distance of a number of museums such as Rijkesmuseum. Some great restaurants are within walking distance (try Uncle Wong's). The rooms were huge and there was a surprise bonus of a laundry for guests to use. Typical of NH hotels, wifi was only available in the lobby, but with unlimited vouchers.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: idajimmi
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel stop on a 10 day trip through Europe. The reception let us check in early which was very appreciated since we arrived early in the morning from the USA. Rooms are comfortable and clean and quiet.Hotel offers free internet in the lobby. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NH Museum Quarter Sep 9-11 Sep”
Reviews.Author: iancSurrrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Amsterdam a few times now and this was the first time with this hotel chain and this area. Previously stayed Centrumm area and I would never again stay anywhere other than Soud oest where this is or maybe der pip across the canal Great hotel and magic staff (sometimes you need to find them but they are there and always obliging). Room was on the 5th floor overlooking canal. Great view a scene in itself all day (and night) long. Walking distance of all the major museums. Ate across in the fashion district 1 night (walked) and up in centrum another taxi up - walked back. As another review said the Central station tramms are at the foot of the road (turn right out the hotel entrance about 3 mins walk). Did not eat here at night breakfast only. The staff will get you anything from and umbrella to a razor and cream to I think a bike. I know they gave me 2 of these free. Hotel is used a lot by aircrew and usually this indicates a good place for me. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, so nice and personal”
Reviews.Author: sethmartin
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Clean rooms. Just close enough to get to everything, but far away to be quite.

Reviews.Title: “Saw a mouse, staff was not troubled by it”
Reviews.Author: wahawaha
Reviews.Content: To be honest, before seeing the mouse, I would have probably rated this as either Very Good (due to the nice view of the canals from our room, very large comfortable room, overall look of the hotel, affordable) to Average (quite a walk from the city center, wifi in the lobby only, with a password that expires every 1/2 hour). I have downgraded it to Poor, because when sitting in the bar area, which is in the same room as the restaurant, I saw a mouse behind the counter of the bar. I told the bartender & he shrugged it off, jokingly said, "that's Ricky", and said "Amsterdam is an old city". The door to the outdoor courtyard was open, right behind the bar, so the mouse probably got in that way, but he could have at least made an effort to close the door then, or try to get rid of the mouse (look for it, or lay a trap). That really grossed me out, and I was glad this was our last night there. I repacked my luggage to make sure that I wasn't bringing Ricky home with me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: feinstee
Reviews.Content: I came to Amsterdam for business and was directed to this hotel after many ohers where colleagues were staying were already booked -- and I definitely made out for the better. The location is great -- 2 blocks from Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum, similarly close to a tram stop (#16 and #24) and easy / scenic walking to the main spots in downtown. if you are here for a conference, the hotel is only a 15 minute stroll to the RAI Exibition Centre. My room on the third floor faced the canal (preferable to the courtyard, i think) - and although the street is right there -- it was very quiet. The room - a single queen bed - was spacious, very clean, with amenities that other hotel don't necessarily have (hair dryer, sewing kit, ironing board). My breakfast was included in the rate and my only complaint is the lack of free WiFi in the room (only free in the lobby). If/when i come back to Amsterdam, I woudl defintiely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Becky T
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this hotel last weekend. The Hotel was very clean and beds very comfortable. Only one pillow on the beds, but reception provide you with a choice of 4 different pillows as extras to ensure you have a comfortable stay. There were two receptionists on the night duty. A blonde lady who was absolutely lovely and VERY helpful and nothing was a trouble to her. The other lady wasn't quite as helpful. I had a problem with the Wifi which had gone off and she huffed and puffed when I asked her for help. Other than that it was a very enjoyable stay and great value for money. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Too far from Tram Stops”
Reviews.Author: ptk6660
Reviews.Content: The hotel is outdated and worn. The beds were not comfortable. The location is OK for walking to other places, but not the nicest street. I would not use this hotel again, there are too many others. Dragging luggage from this hotel to the nearest tram stop is very inconvenient - it you come to Amsterdam via train and tram, make sure your hotel is close to a tram stop!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but away from the center”
Reviews.Author: ravenx8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent and is quite near one of the most known Amsterdam's attractions: Heineken Experience. However, it's a little bit far away from the city centre and you will probably need to use public transportation or taxi. It's not one of the most cheapest hotels in Amsterdam, but the conditions are excellent. Enjoy a cold Heineken at the hotel bar!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: SpookyUK
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here recently. I had a standard room overlooking the courtyard. The room was was bigger than average with a decent selection of international chanels (BBC1/2) on the Tv. The bed was fine, bathroom modern and clean. WiF will cost you 8.95 eur for 24 hours. It's fast and stable. Each floor has a vending machne with soft drinks and beer. The bar and restraunt are open plan and near to each other. The draught Heneken is excellent (5 eur a pint) and I enjoyed a great burger and fries late one night (15 eur). It's not too close to the city but the tram stops very close by. A taxi to the station cost us 11 eur. The staff were friendly and efficent. The only issue was when they they thought they had no smoking rooms for my friend and clamed that bookng a smokng room only obliged them to try to accomdate you! It sounded like a well worn excuse to me, I suggest confirming your reservation and press them on important details. I would stay here again but I would ask for a canal view next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: sheri k
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and from the moment we arrived, we were impressed. The staff were extremely helpful, the room was huge and immaculately clean. Plenty of towels, amenities, great quiet location, and extra bed for our child. We used the fitness centre and the restaurant. We would highly recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: jbamail
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on the hotel, paying just over â‚¬100 per night. The hotel is in a good location ... quiet, but a short walk to shops, restaurants, the museum quarter, and transport. The room had not been renovated in a while, but it was very clean and, most surprisingly for amsterdam, very large compared to similarly priced hotels! The bed was very comfortable, the windows could be opened to avoid sleeping in air conditioning. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful (though seriously lacking in knowledge of local restaurants). Free wifi was only available in the lobby. For the price, it was excellent value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service in all areas, not a value for money.”
Reviews.Author: windcharger
Reviews.Content: 1. Most of the staff with the exception of one lady was rude and highly misguiding. 2. The room service was expensive and pathetic with no communication in English. 3. The bathrooms were tiled and so downmarket looking. 4. Toiletries were not of very high quality. 5. Only saving grace was the view from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous, just Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: soulparis
Reviews.Content: Love the Hotel, Love the Room, Love the Location!!! I asked for the top floor , aroom with a view & I got it! Spacious, modern, with ceiling to floor windows. The front desk clerks were realy friendly & helpful, I felt very welcomed & I'll definately be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room, terrific breakfast, questionable service.”
Reviews.Author: TxBizTravlr
Reviews.Content: Overall, a decent hotel for Amsterdam. The location right behind the Rijksmuseum is very convenient for a walking tour, near tram lines, close to shopping, food, fun and the Concertgebouw. The breakfast was awesome, with a good variety and real flavor (something often missing in hotel breakfasts). The room was bigger than expected, and I liked the view. The drawback was the housekeeping. I asked for a change of sheets and pillowcase once when the maid was in the room, and was told "No, not today. You can have new bedding on Wednesday" This was on Monday, so I was amazed at the curt answer. The desk staff tried to be helpful when I needed to find a drug store. Unfortunately, the street they directed me to, where they were sure there was a pharmacy, had no such establishment, and I wasted an hour walking about while I was feeling ill and needing some drugs (not the kind Amsterdam is famous for). There is a cute little bar in the hotel, that never seems to be open when anyone wants a drink. Free Wi-Fi only in the lobby, for 30 minute intervals, only with a password, and you have to ask the desk clerk for a new password every 30 minutes. This is a really clumsy approach, and it surprised me. Other NH hotels I have used do a better job with this modern necessity. I give high marks for location, condition of the facility, room size, and food. As for the rest, it needs work. In Amsterdam, the bar is set rather low for hotels, so this one is still recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay out of the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: kazzie242
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this hotel and found it met all of our needs. It was in a good area out of the central district, opposite a canal and leading onto a main canal where the Canal bus went from. Of course as it's name implies it is a stone's throw from the main museums. As we love to walk, Central Station took us about 30 minutes without dawdling. When you get caught up on the canals or in the Red Light District it will take longer. We found the staff at the hotel to be extremely helpful and courteous and the room more than adequate. The view of the canal was a bonus. The bed was very comfy with 4 choices of pillows available. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service I've Ever Experienced”
Reviews.Author: Fur88
Reviews.Content: I failed to get down all names of staff because I was so upset and frustrated that we wanted to get out as soon as possible. From the time we got there until the time we left, it was horrible. When we first arrived, the front receptionist claimed that we cancelled our reservations. Though we were able to book two rooms, they both were not next to each other. One room was double bed and the other was double with an extra twin. When we got to our rooms, both had dirty carpet and the atmosphere was just not what we expected for a 4 star hotel. One of the rooms had a sink with brown burned marks and hair in the sink and on the upper counter above the toilet. Don't expect much from the refrigerator either, its this small tacky thing with nothing in it. If you wanted a drink of water and pay, you'd have to call and order because nothing is there and ready for use. Wifi, dont expect it at all because you can only use it in the lobby and for a duration of 30 minutes unless you're in some "special group". I used it late at night and was able to get another passcode from the front desk who was nice enough to give another one. They were late night shifts who were actually nice. On check out day, i woke up to my phone alarm on the bed and forgot it when we checked out. I called back 30 minutes to have them check if they found my phone and they said no. I came back to the hotel in 15 minutes and the front desk brought me up to my room. My room which we gave tip, was wiped clean. The extra twin bed which i had slept on was gone. They called linens to check if my iphone may have been accidentally taken off with the sheets but no luck. I asked to speak to the staff cleaner but it was in their policy to not allow that. I was then directed o speak to their manager who was nice in an evil way. He basically made me feel like crap because he couldn't prove that i was right and so his staff was able to get away with taking my phone. Where I come from, the customer is always right, he just shooed me off and did not offer to take down my information to contact me if it was to be found. Instead, he gave me "his" card and said try calling us someday and maybe we'll have it. I was in complete shock that I was at a 4 star hotel and my phone was taken and not returned. I replay my phone on my bed over and over and I just cannot believe the staff cleaner got away with taking my phone. I cannot believe they can claim to accidentally put it in the linens when I know damn well the cleaner had to pick up my pillow and blanket before taking off the sheets. So, i faced it that my phone would be gone forever. The one front desk receptionist (really upset i didn't get down names!), she was kind enough to direct us to the police station to get a report so I could send to my insurance. We went to the police station and not to my surprise, was treated like crap again. The office had a defensive stance with his hands on his waste and talked with an aggressive demanding attitude. He refused to write up a report and kept asking me to give him my registration number of the phone so they could find it. At that point I wasn't even worried about finding it because I already knew it would never be retrieved ever again. His little fairytale world thinks you can just track a phone and get it back when in reality people can wipe out your phone and use it as if it was bought. We went back and forth for 10 minutes and I'm trying to figure out with this douche just cannot write up a simple report. He finally calls out his chief who was actually really nice! he wrote up the report, I kindly thanked him for his help and we headed right back to the hotel. We asked the front desk to confirm our report, she said she could not do that. Her "colleague" who is the manager, was only able to do that. She gave us so much attitude and difficulty about getting her "colleague" to do it. She then claimed that he and the staff were in a meeting. We got upset and asked when will this meeting be over and we were fussing and all that when eventually the receptionist next to her (the nice one) spoke to her in dutch and we could tell she was like why can't you just go in and get in and she got up and got him immediately. We were in total awe that we were spoken to that way by her, lied to by her, and treated that way at all as a customer. When the manager came out, he tried to give me a hard time about just confirming the report saying he cannot say this and that because it would make them liable. I said, i didn't need him to state much but to confirm our stay at the hotel. After fussing with him for about 5 minutes, he finally wrote it and stapled "HIS" card to it which he did not give me in the first place. After all we went through, no phone. One customer was kind enough to ask if I was ok (American) and thats when I felt homesick because America would never treat you like that no matter what hotel you're in. I couldn't believe the amount of attitude and rudeness came from these people. NEVER EVER EVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL! THIS IS NOT A 4 STAR HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: EmandDee
Reviews.Content: It's ok but not a patch on the NH Brugge which is really super. The chain needs to be more consistent. Parking was a real pain (had to use the Olympic Stadium Park and Ride - NB if you do that make sure you go to the concierge in the car park and specify "Park and Ride" and validate your tickets. Good location. Bar staff uninterested and unhelpful with getting food. Finally got bowl of frites (â‚¬4!). And my flannel disappeared in cleaning which was a bit annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: RJW3
Reviews.Content: Very good location near a tram stop. Hotel very clean and tidy Large spacious room - good modern bathroom with excellent shower. Breakfast very good with an excellent selection of different items - pastries cooked on thepremises. A bit expoensive but considering what other hotels were charging it was reasonable value. If you don't mind walking then this is ideal but watch out for the mad cyclists which come at you from all angles at all times of the night and day !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in nice location”
Reviews.Author: NYC7777777
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip via Gate1 travel agency with a huge discount, because it was for shoulder season- Middle of March. The cost of flight if booked separately would have been about equal to the cost of the package with 4 nights and included good breakfast (otherwise 19 euros pp). Location is very nice, 5 min from the Van Gogh and National Museums. Trams 16 and 24 are nearby. Bus 197 brings you to museum area from airport in ~25 minutes for 4 euros. Ask for a canal view-no extra charge for floor 5 and below.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, staff is fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: alexislouise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were first-time visitors to Amsterdam, and we chose this hotel because of the proximity to the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum. We were not all disappointed with this hotel. The staff was wonderful to us; could not have been more helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel overall.”
Reviews.Author: Gregstar1971
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel even if it is at least 15 minutes by tram from the station. We had trouble finding it as the computer directory service at the central station (which printed maps) had all the other NH hotels listed but not this one. The rooms are very nice, roomy and clean. The staff are very helpful and professional. There is a single computer in the lobby for use but you have to continually get tickets to use it for every 15 minutes. We accidentally booked an extra night through expedia. Sadly they were not generous enough to give our money back for that one Friday night. Which they would have easily filled so they greedily earned double the income for that room. It was our fault for not being correct with expedia. However I would have given a refund or at least a partial token refund, considering we paid for 9 nights. They also charged us city tax for the mistaken extra day of our booking even though we were not even in the country at that stage. So sadly this left me with a slightly bitter attitude towards the place. However, apart from that a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: dukeontario
Reviews.Content: Pros: - great location - clean Cons: - expensive breakfast buffet (19 euro) - no available taxis (10 min at least) - lackluster front desk staff - gym with 1 treadmill / crammed into the space of 1 1/2 rooms There must be many better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent business hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: m1508
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within walking distance to (of course) the Museum Square as well as the Leidse Plein, where you have access to a large number of restaurant, cafe's and museums. Only downside of the location is the proximity of a fire station. The rooms are spacious and neutrally decorated, the come with a safe, AC, TV and of course a nice and clean bathroom. The staff was nice, if slightly disorganised (possibly due to the very small reception desk and the large number of guests). The price of the hotel is on the high side, but rather standard for a business hotel. Breakfast costs an extra 20 EUR, taxi to/from Central Station 15-20 EUR, shuttle service to airport is offered.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kakos_theo
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very clean overall, in fact the bathroom was the cleanest hotel bathroom I've ever seen in my life. the service was excellent and the location is convenient to some of the major museums like the Van Gogh museum and the national museum. We were there for five days and did not use public transportation at all, except to get back and forth from Centraal Station (train station) to the airport (Schipol.) Although they offered us an upgrade to a room with a canal view for 15-35 euros (can't remember exactly,) once we declined and were shown to our room, we could see the canal from our window, in addition to other awesome architecture. (the window took up one entire wall, which was awesome.) The bed was fine, the shower was the nicest one I've ever experienced, and the complimentary breakfast was exceptional. in other words, I would stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone wishing to stay in the museum quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Bed quality a major issue but hotel has positives”
Reviews.Author: kurtrs
Reviews.Content: Overall I thought the service was fine- the morning breakfast which we added in to our reservation was fabulous (french pastries, Dutch cheese, bangers, scrambled eggs, yogurt, little pancakes)- the location was convenient to the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum, and the scenery around the hotel was wonderful - our view was of the canal across the street. Nearby the hotel there is a wonderful Italian restaurant (walk down the street and go over the bridge) in addition to a "coffee shop" if you are so inclined to try that out. There is a large open market called the Albert Cuyp (http://www.amsterdam.info/shopping/albert_cuypmarkt/) which is also over the bridge and down the way in addition to an Albert Heijn supermarket for bread, fruit, wine and groceries, as our room had a refrigerator. We made use of the laundry facilities and the weight room. The front desk though not effusive was nonetheless efficient. The cleanliness of the room was ok but the shower did not drain well and one side of our queen size bed in room 623 was worn out and the coils in the mattress could be felt by whoever slept on that side. The management said this mattress would be replaced but we weren't offered another room. The Dutch themselves aren't really very helpful so I wasn't surprised. There are ALOT of airline personnel that stay here which might explain why just one side of our mattress was totally worn out?

Reviews.Title: “service really outstanding”
Reviews.Author: neno67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a business 4 stars hotels, but very impressed by the service: such a kind attention to customer I've found only in Japan! Really you feel at home, a little bit expensive (but unfortunately this is quite common in amsterdam) but very nice room (I book superior room).

Reviews.Title: “convenient, comfortable, well located”
Reviews.Author: marcopolo1964
Reviews.Content: When we decided to do a long weekend in Amsterdam with our six-year old daughter, I first imagined that we'd stay in some charming old house on a canal. But as I looked into it, all such hotels were too expensive, full, or had some other problem. So I took the advide of an Amsterdam-based colleague and booked the NH Museum Quarter. I have no regrets. It's a modern building, lacking in charm, but everything else about the hotel was great. It's on a quiet canal (not the most beautiful of the city's canals, but a nice one nonetheless), very convenient to to the main art museums, a five-minute walk to streets full of varied restaurants and bars, and a fairly easy stroll into the historic center. Within 10 minutes of the hotel you are walking the historic central canals. We would walk into the center, and then take a tram back. We took the basic room and it was plenty large for a rollaway bed. The rooms are well designed with plenty of closet space, a safe, a dryer, a fridge, and electric kettle. The hotel has a laundermatte, a small but well appointed gym, and icemaking machines on each floor. The bed was comfortable and the litte bit of traffic on the canal never bothered us. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel felt like an American hotel, in good sense of being roomy and full of conveniences. We could have had our room for 120 euros a night if I had paid ahead. Our room came to 135 euros without prepayment. Still, I felt it was good value for such a large room in a city center. The breakfast is a bit pricey at 19 euros a head, but they never charged us for our daughter, and it's such a huge spread of fruit, cereal, eggs, cheeses, and cold cuts that we didn't need lunch. A few complaints: we could never get the supposedly free wi-fi to work (but we didn't try that hard either), and the room service menu is limited, pricey, and not terribly good (it was our first night, our daughter was tired from a full day of travel, and I didn't know how much good takeout there is in the neighborhood).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: editorindisguise
Reviews.Content: If you check the hotel website, it will tell you NH Museum Quarter is located 1 km from the city centre. When you get there, you will discover it is possible for a city to have more than one city centre! The hotel is actually some 3 km from Dam Square which most people believe is the centre of Amsterdam. Oh, well! The hotel itself is lovely, cosy and secure. While we are made to wait a bit for our smoking room (we are reminded it was only a request, not a confirmation), the room itself makes up for the delay. It's on the first-floor, overlooks the canal and is quite simply huge (we were upgraded, it seems). The room is well appointed without being luxurious and the bed is very comfortable. The bathroom has nice, large towels and basic amenities. And there is a complimentary tea/coffee service which the staff is happy to replenish. Getting around by tram in Amsterdam is easy and the stop for nos. 16 and 24 is a street away. The staff is helpful in showing us how to get there, and efficient the next morning in arranging a taxi for us to get to the station. And oh, the complimentary internet is available only in the lobby but irritatingly requires a fresh password every 30 minutes. Overall, this has been a pleasant stay although we wish they hadn't been quite so imprecise with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and spacious rooms, close to center location.”
Reviews.Author: MinniMee
Reviews.Content: Booked at the hotel after long search through Amsterdam hotels and overall pleased with our choice. However it is basic hotel, little bit rundown (carpet stains and wall cracks). When you "get used" to this, positive values come first: location close to center, but not to centered so there is enough space for rooms to be big (enormous for Amsterdam standards), with beautiful huge balcony windows with a nice view to canal. Sitting by the open window - very enjoyable during summer. Reception staff very helpful and friendly. Stay at this hotel, but as advised everyone else do not book hotels expensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Amsterdam, very pretty area and close to the museums.”
Reviews.Author: aliakapoor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here at the end of our European holiday. We stayed at the ibis on the way in and then NH on the way out.... loved it! the location was perfect and we asked for a top floor canal facing room and they gave us a super room with an incredible view with big french-like windows (floor to ceiling), so the view was just amazing. tea and coffee in the room and they have thought of everything you might need - including a laundry room, gym, clothes line in the bathroom and you can ask for a fancy pillow as well to help you sleep better. the breakfast was 24 euro so we skipped it but there are so many cafes in amsterdam plus albert heijn grocery stores so you can always manage with food. walking distance to the Rijks museum and van gogh museum and rent a bike from mac bikes and then just ride around the city (watch out for the trams though)... dont bike too slow or the locals may horn at you.... would def stay here again especially since its a very pretty area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum”
Reviews.Author: Nomad59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit bland but the room was very big and clean, the beds were comfortable and the balcony looking over the canal was a nice surprise. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Although it is quite a way from Dam Square, the tram stop (nos 16 & 24) is just around the corner and for 2.60 euro you can travel anywhere within the hour as long as you keep registering your ticket on and off the tram. Catch the same tram too and from the main railway station. The hotel is 5 min stroll to the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum - order your entrance tickets online, otherwise you will queue for hours, same goes for the Anne Frank house. Didn't have breakfast in the hotel but plenty of places to grab a coffee and croissant. In the evening, try the Monte Verde Italian restaurant just over the bridge. Don't be put off by the cheap prices - pizza, pasta, etc only 5 euro - the pizza, salad, tiramisu and Merlot were very good.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, a bit far, smelly, and dated...”
Reviews.Author: rlgm007
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading other comments regarding the hotel's close proximity into town when in reality its quite far from Amsterdam's central station and Dam Square. Be prepared to walk a long while or take a tram into town (rent a bike - there are several bike rental shops nearby). It is near the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum. The hotel itself is nothing special and appears dated. Its across the street from a nice canal and located in an upscale quite neighborhood. Its ideal for large tour groups (one group parked their rather large bus in front of the main entrance) that must smoke because the entire hotel reeks of cigarette smoke. The Continental Airlines crew spent the night here. The rooms are quite large and offer comfortable beds with a selection of different types of pillows (you call for the one that suits you). You'll also find a safe, iron/board, refrigerator, and a hot water pot with instant coffee/tea in the room. The TV did not work, the bathroom had several large strands of hair laying around, and they provide orange scented shampoo -- great shower. My sister in the room next to mine had a balcony which softened the the room's starkness. The entire hotel should offer free wifi throughout the hotel but only gives 30 minute of free wifi in the lobby. Breakfast not included and costs 19 Euros (not worth it - eat at Sara's Pancake House down the street from Ann Frank's House). Staff very friendly and helpful. Note: I didn't see the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms next to canal and close to nightlife of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: rajkul
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have stayed in recently (business or leisure). This one has spacious rooms good enough for you to jog inside in case you have to ;) Nightlife in Amsterdam is great in few pockets, one of which hosting hard rock cafe etc. is close enough to walk to. Also the famous Von Gogh museum, Rijksmuseum and the I Amsterdam signage is at a walking distance. Definitely a pleasing place with good connectivity and close to cultural hubs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service - nice location”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Dutchman9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights for my destination wedding in Amsterdam. The hotel provided us with a complimentary upgrade to a nice suite when they found out about our wedding. Their attention and service has been great - all the staff was very helpful. Having lived in Amsterdam for 6 years before, I would definately recommend this hotel to any visitors looking for a fairly new hotel, close by the city and next to the museum area.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and friendly”
Reviews.Author: juhso
Reviews.Content: I'd booked this hotel as a last stage of a European trip and worried a) about the distance from the station b) the impersonal nature of big hotels. a) A tram takes you close to the hotel and it is really well situated for so many of Amsterdams sights. b) The staff were fantastic and couldn't do enough for us. The room was massive with a great view. The bar was well stocked Would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel in excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: fmck49
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious (with a kettle, tea and coffee - unusual for mainland Europe) and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. I had asked for a quiet room overlooking the canal. Although the road runs alongside the canal, the windows are well glazed and there is little noise. They gave my friend the room opposite for our convenience. Breakfast is a buffet with lots of choice and freshly baked bread. The hotel is within a few minutes walk of the Rijksmuseum, the Canal Bus and the Van Gogh Museum. There are also plenty of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: jantravlz
Reviews.Content: We had to stay here for 5 nights, waiting for our flight back to the U.S. while the volcanic ash cloud cleared up. Amsterdam is a nice city, but doesn't always take credit cards. Good thing we had extra Euros along. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helped us as much as possible, including free internet access in the lobby. Thank goodness for that! But I have nothing good to say about Avalon Waterways or United Airlines, both of whom did not help us at all. The best option, for future travel, is carry a cell phone with an international calling card.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Clean hotel and Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: HousePeople
Reviews.Content: Firstly we would like to convey our utmost thanks to Raymond on reception who helped as so much in helping us resolve a booking issue caused by the booking agent. Noticing how upset we were with this problem, he upgraded us as a goodwill gesture to one of their superior rooms on the top floor which had a canal view, without this view itâ€™s difficult to say how the other standard rooms were as the decor and facilities were still quite basic. We were still very grateful for his help with this and appreciated his friendly helpful manner. The Hotel is in a good location being close to tram number 16 and 24 towards Central Station. There is also an underground supermarket opposite the Concert Gebouw, which is handy for food and other provisions. The hotel is very clean and modern; however we would say this particular hotel is furnished like a good UK Travelodge which by the way would not deter us from returning. We were however, surprised about the breakfast, which had been recommended as being really good in a number of previous reviews. We would disagree as we found it fairly standard with the usual low quality powdered scrambled eggs, and generally average quality bacon sausages and mushrooms. Also as part of the breakfast service they have a coffee/tea machine where you serve yourself â€“ again something that youâ€™d expect in a low budget hotel as opposed higher standard hotel. Again this would not deter us from returning however for travellers planning to go at least you will have abetter expectation of the breakfast. The overall stay was very enjoyable with little disruption following the problem with our initial booking. If youâ€™re looking for a hotel offering good value for money this is one to go for.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great trip”
Reviews.Author: p_rez86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the nh museum quarter in November 2009. We arrived late and didn't have a swipe card to get in to the hotel, however the reception staff soon let us in. The room was excellent, of a large size and in great condition. The food (breakfast) in the hotel was also good, although we thought the restaurant staff could have been a little bit more friendly, however they were professional. The location of the hotel is somewhat away from the city centre, however there is a tram line nearby that takes you into the city centre, therefore making the distance not a problem at all. I would recommend this hotel and would come back here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Very Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Iakinthos
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is lovely, new and clean with modern and cosy atmosphere and friendly staff. The rooms are big compared to other hotels in Amsterdam. We asked for a room on a high floor and we were given a beautiful and comfortable room on the 7th floor with canal view. We had a great stay. We will never forget the marvelous view we had when it was snowing. Breakfast is fantastic. The hotel is close to the Rijksmuseum and the Leidseplein with hundreds of restaurants and bars and the shopping district of Amsterdam. The tram station is 2 minutes walk from the hotel entrance. We will definitely return. The only negative points are the beds being very soft and that they only offer 15 minutes of free internet access. It should be free for their quests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorkOwl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. On arrival the hotel staff are very welcoming and even though we arrived early- before 10am- they had an available room and so we were able to check in which we hadn't been expecting. We also had the option on the day of check out to have the room for the full day- or they've a storage room for luggage. The breakfast here is lovely- good selection- pancakes, meats, cheeses, fruits, cereals, eggs, fried breakfast and more. Only complaint is that coffee is from a machine that wasn't always working. They serve breakfast til11 week mornings and til 12 at weekends- great to have this option when you're on holidays. The rooms are very spacious, modern and clean with plenty of wardrobe space. One small complaint about the rooms is the air conditioning/heating vent. Despite turning it off at night it seemed to make a very slight constant noise- as if on a very low level- which can be annoying when you're trying to sleep. Bathrooms are a good size, with a good shower and always plenty of hot water. The hotel was quite busy during our stay- seems to be the hotel of choice for KLM cabin crew which is always a good sign. The bar was very quiet though- often we'd stop on our way in at night for a drink and be the only ones. We didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that. Despite being busy- there was never any noise at night or early morning. Rooms seem to be well soundproofed. The hotel is a 2 min walk from the nearest tram stop- 16 and 24- both go into Dam square and you won't be waiting more than 5 mins at any time. The transport system in this city is amazing (esp compared with Ireland!). If you are coming from central station I would recommend getting the tram to the hotel. Contact the hotel beforehand to find out the name of the exact stop. Taxis are very expensive here. When we arrived we got a taxi the 10 min journey which cost over â‚¬20. Trams 16 and 24 both depart from central station. ( On arrival at the airport go to the tourist information where you can buy tram and train tickets for the whole of your stay- for example- it cost â‚¬25.00 for a 4 day tram ticket and return train ticket from Schipol to central station).

Reviews.Title: “lovely quiet clean hotel, not far walk from anywhere”
Reviews.Author: madleypiper
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the hotel at 11.30 am and was allowed into the room straight away even though checkin wasnt suppose to be til 2pm. we could have upgraded to a canal room for about 15 euros but not much happens on the canal so we didnt. rooms were cleaned very day. room was lovely a spacious with ensuite. had a mini fridge, hairdryer, iron and safe. the fitness room was clean and lots of machines but looked hardly touched. we didnt use the bar or restaurant as a a continental breakfast was 19 euros which we personally think is too much. out and about breakfast is about 9/10 euros. the receptionists were very nice and confident speaking in different languages. we got to the hotel by the connexions bus which we paid for in the airport near the exit. think it was 22.50 euros return or 14 euros single. then we arranged at the receptoion to be picked up the day before we departed. we booked the hotel through sleep and go which saved us money if one of the people in the room was aged between 18 and 30. so we got the room virtually half price each night. its not a 18-30's hotel if you are thinking of the booze etc, it was just an offer they do for people in that age range. it took us about 15 mins to walk to the red light district and another 5/10 to ann franks house. 2 of the museums were shut. it was easy to find way back if you said/looked for the rikjis museum. would defo stay here again. although the amount of walking was a bit much for my feet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mara19
Reviews.Content: Very good location - close to the Concert Gebouw from where you can take the tram to Amstelveen area or to the down town area, 10 minutes of walking to the Van Gogh Museum. The receptionists are OK, the breakfast is very tasty (a bit expensive for the diversity you recieve), the room was clean. At the departure I received a voucher of 30 eur...I don't think I will use it but as an incentive is a good marketing tool.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money in a quiet neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: 79Nina79
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel over the NH-website and got a good price for 2 nights (430Euros). We didnt book breakfast as 19Euros per person for breakfast seems like a lot of money, especially if you only want to have a coffee and something small in the morning. The rooms are a good size and we were on the 5th floor which has a nice view. The hotel is a bit away from the center but not too far by tram and if you are glad to be away from the noisy and busy center this is a good place to stay. Also it is only about 5mins walk from the VanGogh museum. There are also a few good restaurants not far from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I still dream about their wonderful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: LadyZed
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week as a birthday treat and to catch a gig at the Melksweg - got a fantastic deal on this hotel with breakfast included which was a great bonus. Excellent location walking distance to the museum quarter where Van Gogh Museum is. Just across from VG is the best museum in the world (probably) Bols Museum (the famous cocktail ingredient) colourful and fun with free cocktails and shots at the end - brilliant at 4pm! Had a canal side view in a quiet location but easy to walk into town - Boom Chicago is worth a visit if you get chance. Hotel was comfortable and a good size room although not much storage. We were moved into the smoking wing after the first night as they'd not been available on our first night despite booking. All fine though but smoking wing only appeared to be accessible by lift - we found this out when we were shut out of the hotel in an attempt to save electricity by using stairs - actually a fire escape! Helpful staff on fag break fortunately snuck us back in. Hotel caters for airline staff which was fine and meant amazing array at breakfast, anything you could possibly imagine wanting at that time was provided and extra late lunch on Sunday (open til 12!) Didn't bother with the restaurant as the bar man advised we just heat it up in the microwave same as room service, he seemed more bothered about chatting to the drinkers.... reception staff were fantastic though and very helpful. All in all had an amazing holiday, good friendly staff and the best breakfasts ever! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: Phil6184
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because other reviewers said it was away from all the craziness. That is true. This hotel is located in an upscale neighborhood within easy walking distance of The Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum and Vondelpark. The Leidesplein is also only a 10 minute walk. Two tram lines easily connect the hotel with Centraal Station. The hotel itself is modern and comfortable. I found my room to be large and well appointed, except for one curious thing. There was almost no storage for clothes. Not one dresser drawer to be found. I did have a canal view and enjoyed it, but if you absolutely want quiet, I suggest you get a room facing the courtyard. Service was very good. Breakfast was better than most buffets and included eggs to order, but you had to ask the lovely woman manning the dining room. In short, this is a well run, comfortable property, away from the crowds but close enough to the hot spots too.

Reviews.Title: “very happy nice stay”
Reviews.Author: alzo
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night in june ,never heard of this chain ,booked with hotel via travelsupermarket.com ,price very acceptable ,not plush as in 5 star sense but a very clean ,great staff ,large room ,very good location 15 min walk to centre of amsterdam ,grat location for 1-2 ngt stays (transit hotel ) ,located on a quiet street beside a canal ,lots of transport near by ,would i stay again ,yes .alan

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LondonCass
Reviews.Content: We had a romantic weekend with my boyfriend. We decided to stay there as we found a very cheap offer online. When we arrived to the hotel we relaised we booked the wrong date. Oops!!! They were amazing, they allowed us to stay for the same price and even upgraded us to canal view for free. The employees were all very nice and helpful. We rented bikes in the hotel and had a FAB weekend!!! With no doubt we will stay at NH Museum Quarter again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fihoney
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and was very happy overall. We had 2 rooms in a nice quiet side as we requested and rooms very large and comfortable. One lift was out of order for a few days but that was a minor issue. Breakfast was included and we found it very good .

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but good”
Reviews.Author: TheBitterEnd
Reviews.Content: It takes 1 hour by foot from Central Station and 30 minutes to gay area. Place is quite and "canal view" rooms are really nice: you can see the evening sky even from your bathtub. It's located near some museums (Royal museum and Museum of Heineken) and a huge letters "I AMsterdam", but it takes time if you go clubbing and in rainy time that area looks boring. Rooms are good, but there was a lot of dust everywhere. Gym is for free, but I didn't go there, cause receptionist told me that it's small and there is no swimming pool, sauna and even shower. By the way, there is public swimming pool in 300m from hotel. Price is normal for the hotel if you stay with somebody. It's not really good for one person. When you check in stuff blocked full price plus 50 euro on your bank account, and I still haven't got my 50 euro back. But I hope I will.

Reviews.Title: “Far from great”
Reviews.Author: thechile
Reviews.Content: Room was NOT 4 star. Carpets were filthy, with dirt and grime embedded. When you have an orange carpet and black tar like spots it's not very nice. The Ice bucket was filthy and full of green mould. We used lastminute and as a special deal we were meant to have a full mini bar that we could use for no charge. We weren't expecting any booze in there, maybe some water and couple cans of coke but it was empty and when we asked for something we were told no. The air vent on the room is VERY noisy and there is nothing you can do to fix it. Imagine a old PC computer with a noisy fan.. stick it to the room of a small room and try to get to sleep. Terrible. Since we arrived late we just used the hotel restaurant, which was a massive joke. The restaurant menu and room service menu is same. Very small selection. The chicken and cheese sandwich i had arrived with melted cheese but it was stone cold. When we went to pay, it took us 20min since the room we were staying in was still under the previous persons name! The breakfast was so so, nothing special. When we checked out we needed to print the online booking tickets.. which they charged us 35 cents per A4 sheet of paper. Gee thanks. Our room was on 3rd floor if that makes any difference. Overall i was very disappointed considering the 4 star rating and the price. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay that was not to be”
Reviews.Author: aish_mom
Reviews.Content: We were to stay here with our two kids under 12. Front desk staff said we had not told them that we have 2 kids coming and they have limitaion of 3 persons in a room. Well, the booking site never asked and it actuallhy mentioned that all kids under 12 stay free. And this is how we had done for all other locations in our Germany-Austria and misc. trip. They realised it was not our fault, the manager found us a quad room in other NH hotel with higher star rating for the same price for the miscommunication.. So I will give 5* for the service. I suggested them to update their profile for the hotel booking sites and they asked me to always verify with hotel:-). I am used to such service level in USA but I could not say the same for Europe so I was happy that they cared to solve the problem.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing, within the madness!”
Reviews.Author: Chesterginge
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. As we were in Amsterdam for the Easter weekend, it was very difficult to find anywhere at all within budget, that wasn't miles away or a hostel. This place seemed cheap, and near enough to walk to the centre - my two main considerations! However, this place was much more than that. We arrived at ten AM, after having been up since 3am. We were fully expecting to be told we had to come back after 2, but were pleasantly surprised to be told that there was a room available. We had booked a smoking room, and we still don't know if what we got was a soming room or not. There were no ash trays, but also no "no smoking" signs. We smoked in there and had no problems. One thing - they wanted to take an impression of a credit card, but as we wanted to pay in cash they took a 50 pound deposit instead. This was re imbursed on our last day, and it worked out well because it meant that we didn't have to worry about keeping money aside for the last day. The location is good - really nice bar over the road, and near to nice bars, cafes, etc. I was concerned it was too far from the centre, but I realise now that the centre really isn't all that great, and the areas further out are nicer and less tacky. It took us about 20 mins to walk to Dam square, which was fine, and as near as I would want to be to the place! One thing about the trams- really easy to use and cheap, but we did have trouble getting off at the right place! We never managed to get up in time, and always ended up getting off at the next stop. It wasn't a problem, but it might be worth bearing in mind. It's not a typically touristy stop, so you wont be able to rely on others getting off too. We never ate in the hotel, so I can't comment on that. The bath was lovely, loads of hot water, as was the shower. It was all pretty quiet, even though we were by a lift. I also liked the fact that we got a lovely view of the canal, with nice big windows that opened. Good, as it was hot and sunny! I liked this hotel because we felt like we were free to do as we liked; we never felt that we were being hassled, the room was nice and clean but we never saw the maid, and reception were really helpful if you asked for it. The fridge in the room worked well, the hairdryer was good, and the bed was large and comfy. I would definitely stay again. Only thing I wold change was the toiletries in the bathroom. There was only a small cheap looking shampoo and shower gel. As I imagine a lot of visitors will only be arriving with hand luggage and nothing else, it would have been good to have more toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: paycheck
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, modern decor and great location. From central station trams 16 and 24 stop just around the corner and if you like to visit museums there are several only a short walk away. The staff were very polite and the bedroom was large and spotlessly clean. I did not use the restaurant so cannot comment on the food. I got a great deal with last minute.com Â£10 per night but would not hesitate to pay the full rate should we visit Amsterdam in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: OldScarborian
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at NH Museum Quarter. We booked the hotel through the NH Hotels website. Our 'deal' involved a king size room with canal view and included breakfast. I think we got a good package for what we paid. Our room was on the 7th (top) floor. It occupied a corner of the hotel above the hotel entrance. It, therefore, had a great view. The room had a significant amount of glass windows. We found that this amount of glass, plus the fact that Amsterdam was pretty cold during our stay - not a complaint because we were really pleased not to have rain during our four days, meant it was difficult to get the room to a reasonable temperature. We did find it cold in the room at times. We were surprised, given the size of the room, at the lack of space for hanging and storing our clothes. Most of our clothes stayed in our suitcases as there was nowhere to put them. Had we been visiting at a warmer time of the year, i.e. less clothes taken with us, and for only one or two nights, the storage space would have been fine. Last negative comment: the lighting in the room could have been better. Now for the positives: All the staff in the reception and breakfast areas of the hotel were great, friendly and helpful at all times. The buffet breakfast was very good. It offered a good choice of hot and cold food and drink and was taken in a very nice dining room. We needed to leave the hotel early on our last day, before the buffet breakfast service commenced. We were very pleased that we were able to take an early room service breakfast at no extra cost. The hotel is very clean and modern. We were very pleased with its location. We would not have wanted to have been in the busier centre of Amsterdam, and found the museum area to be just right. We could walk to the centre easily when we wanted to and found some very good restaurants close to the hotel. We were particulary pleased with Brasserie Bark and De Knijp, only 10 minutes walk away on Van Baerlestraat. When we arrived at Schiphol we took the Connexxion shuttle to the hotel. We also used this for our return journey. This is an excellent value means of travelling between hotel and airport in Amsterdam. On the whole we enjoyed staying at this hotel and think that it was a good choice. We would certainly stay at the hotel again if we return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kikujiro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is usually our first choice when staying in Amsterdam after going to a concert at the "Concertgebouw". The hotel is about a 10 minutes walk from the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum. There is also a tram stop nearby (5 minutes by foot). Near the Leidseplein, approximately a 15 minutes walk from the hotel, are numerous restaurants. Check-in and check-out at the hotel is quick and businesslike. You can upgrade to a canal view room, but we have always been fortunate enough to have a canal view room without having to pay an additional fee. Rooms are quite large, especially compared to other Amsterdam hotels in the same price range. Rooms have coffee and tea making facilities, a small fridge (empty), an iron and ironing board, a small safe and a bathtub. On each floor there is an ice machine. If you arrive or leave early you can leave your luggage in a locked room near the lobby. We will definitely stay at this hotel again during future visits to Amsterdam. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Easy and efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: ijdwright
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in November 2008. Everything was straight forward and efficient with this hotel. Nothing spectacular but everything you would expect from a chain hotel. Liken it to a Travelodge in the UK - clean, good basic level of service. Location was good, just south of the Rijksmuseum and close to the excellent tram service - lines 16 and 24. If you are looking for a simple, no-fuss hotel I'd definitely recommend this particular NH Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: soeti
